Communist Party of the United States of America Records

Gus Hall joined the CPUSA in 1927. He became an active organizer and leader in the Young Communist League, and later, in the steel industry. He rose through the Party's ranks and was named General Secretary in 1959. His title was changed to National Chairman during the late 1980s, a position he held until his death in 2000. This subseries holds Hall's correspondence, article drafts, reports, and speech notes and drafts, the bulk of which were created during his time as General Secretary. A large portion of this subseries is made up of spiral books kept by Hall for note-taking purposes. Notes, proofs, and research compiled for the book Gus Hall Bibliography: the Communist Party USA: Philosophy, History, Program, Activities (1981) are also available in this series. Photographs added to this series in 2017 contain images of Hall, which document his personal life as well as work in the Party. A small set of personal photographs feature Hall in his youth, while the majority document Hall acting in his official capacity as Party Chairman at public events and on foreign trips.
